name: Crimstopia
startIntroPart1: Zappelyne Crims of Crimstopia, a powerhouse of a civilization that will truly conquer the world with an iron fist that will shoot down any attempts at destruction of this nation, lead the way, our great Matriarch. Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: You have been too much of a burden to us, prepare for war.
defeated: We have lost, but history repeats itself and you will fall as the gates of hell swallow you whole.
tradeRequest: Whether this deal is fair or not, I think it is in your best interest to accept.

name: Vestige
startIntroPart1: Frost Acolyte of The Vestige, a great organization turned nation, destroyed in 2035. But is Vestige truly gone? As the name implies, we still leave a mark on this world. Can we build a civiization that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: May the gods have mercy on your souls.
tradeRequest: Shut up and accept or deny this trade.

name: Goldenhand
startIntroPart1: Midas Goldenhand of the Nation of Goldenhand, a nation formerly a cooperation which rised up through careful 'negotiations' and loopholes, a nation full of great merchants and nobles which nearly fell to the hands of the Crimstopians in 2041. Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
defeated: Will you let me go if I give you ten thousand?
introduction: Ah! Another person to trade with!
neutralHello: Is there something I can help you with?
hateHello: Just know that I won't give you a discount.
tradeRequest: I've been waiting to strike this trade for a while now!

name: Scarlet Legion
startIntroPart1: Crimson Karita of the Scarlet Legion, our great leader who rules with the might of a thousand lions, a civilization with the power of gods thriving under the rule of Karita. After being assassinated, the kingdom fell into anarchy and eventually fell days after your death. But here you are, reborn in a brand new world. Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: You really should've seen this coming.
introduction: You should savor your time, as it will end soon.
tradeRequest: I don't believe you have a choice in this matter.
